section.title:
Deploy p2 updatesite to Nexus
Setup Distribution Management When a Nexus is installed on localhost, the following Distribution Management will likely be used:
Credentials for the nexus
To define the credentials to login to the Nexus Server you can add an entry for the user credentials to your local ~/m2/settings.xml file.
The <id> must fit to the <id> of the repository in the Distribution Management, e.g., both are named nexus .
Only deploy the p2 update site
When using mvn clean deploy usually all build artifacts of all modules are deployed to the Nexus.
In the context of Tycho usually only deploying the p2 updates is desired, since these should be available for target definitions or application updates.
In order to archive this the deploy phase can be skipped by using the maven.deploy.skip property in the root parent pom.
This property will be derived by all child modules so that they will not be deployed unless a child module overrides this property. And this is supposed to be done in the p2 update site module.
So this property should be false for all p2 update site modules.
